text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today I've 
got another breakfast recipe to share with you in

Thailand we don't have too many breakfasts 
specific dishes we tend to just eat anything

at any meal but this is one of the few things 
that we do have it's something called kao tom

kao means rice tom means to boil so it is a rice 
soup but not quite the same as congee in fact it's

actually easier to make than congee so let's 
get started so I'm gonna start by making what

we call saam gler or thai mirepoix I like to 
call it and that is white peppercorns and I get

that ground up first alright that's all ground 
up by the way sound glow means three friends so

now we can add the second friend that is garlic 
get that pound up in fact I'm gonna add the third

friend as well and that is cilantro stems if you 
have cilantro Bruce do use that I don't right now

so stems will work and this is a base for so many 
dishes marinades rubs stir fry so many different

dishes now we're going to push our friends into a 
paste so you really want it a nice fine paste just

like that so now I'm gonna put half of it into my 
protein which I am using shrimp today come come

or shrimp comb is a very popular version but you 
can do fish you can do chicken you can do whatever

you want really so I'm gonna add to some of it 
into the shrimp here and I've cut the shrimp up

because I like I like it when it mixes well into 
the rice so you don't have to you know try to cut

up a shrimp with a spoon while you're having the 
soup now shrimp generally have a natural saltiness

to them already so I don't want to solve this at 
all but if you're doing chicken or pork or fish

you might want to do just a dash of fish sauce 
or soy sauce I also have some that I kept whole

because this would be my garnish so put you know a 
couple of pieces on top so people can clearly see

this is a stream Cup um all right let's cook these 
off so I'm just gonna saute my shrimp in a little

skillet here this part is not super traditional 
most people just blanch this room but blanching

shrimp doesn't add any flavor right when you 
saute something gets a little brown so much more

flavor so that's what I'm gonna do a little oil in 
there once the oil is getting hot I'm gonna add my

cut-up shrimp I'm just gonna cook that until it's 
done which should take just one minute of the most

because it's so small okay so now the shrimp 
is done see all this brown garlic bit stuck at

the bottom that's all flavor I'm gonna lift it 
off by deglazing a little bit with some stock

which you will need for your soup anyway so you're 
gonna have that just scrape all that off if you're

using a nonstick pan you may not have any sort of 
stuck garlic bits in which case you don't have to

deglaze that on its own is already so delicious 
okay next I'm just gonna sear my whole shrimp

for our garnish and then it's done and that is it 
the shrimp are beautifully seared let's get onto

the rice part all right so I've got here a pot of 
unsalted pork stock for which I have a video you

can absolutely use chicken stock instead if you're 
gonna cheat and use store-bought make sure it's

unsalted chicken stock but makes a big difference 
because we want to be a bad soy sauce and fish

sauce to it I'm gonna just bring this to a simmer 
but while that's coming to a simmer I'm gonna add

the other half of our mushed up three friends 
here and just add that in and it'll help flavor

the broth with garlic and peppercorns and cilantro 
roots all right it's coming to a simmer now you do

want a simmer or boil for about a minute or so 
to make sure the garlic is cooked and I'm gonna

season it with fish sauce here wasn't sure if 
that was fish sauce or soy sauce for a second

there and some soy sauce that's it no sugar no 
nothing I find that the rice has its natural

sweetness the shrimp has a natural sweetness all 
I need is some umami okay so at this point the

broth is base done how easy is that right so if 
you want to make this in advance so that you can

put everything together in the morning quickly 
you want to have this ready at the stage you

want to have your rice already cooked and ready 
to go and then you want to have whatever protein

you want cooked and ready to go and then it's a 
snap to put together so let's say that I am now

ready to eat I put my rice this is already cooked 
precooked jasmine rice into here and it can be

cold doesn't have to be hot now the amount of rice 
is sort of up to you some people like it sort of

thinner and Bharathi or some people like it's full 
full of rice but what you don't want to do is mix

it together far in advance because that rice gonna 
continue to absorb all the liquid so now I'm gonna

add my shrimp back in along with all its glorious 
juices mmm looking at this now I'm actually gonna

add a little bit more rice there we go it's a 
great way to use up leftover rice as well mmm

now some people like to just dump the rice dump 
the soup and be done with it I like it to sort

of come to a simmer one more time because I feel 
like it allows the rice to absorb the flavor of

the broth and I am done how easy is that now there 
are some garnishes that you're gonna want to serve

with this so stay tuned sometimes when you stay 
at a nice hotel in Thailand the breakfast buffet

who usually have a count them station so this 
is reminding me of that right now yes nice so

now the garnish is very similar to like a noodle 
soup garnish so first of all some green onions and

cilantro of course optional but highly recommended 
some fried garlic I mean seriously if you want to

cook Thai food just keep your fridge well-stocked 
with fried garlic and garlic oil it'll come in so

handy so many times there we go a little drizzle 
of garlic oil for extra flavor and some preserved

radish so this is Tang chai again I've used 
this before in my noodle episodes it's like

salty crunchy bits of cabbage it just adds a nice 
texture you know so we're gonna put that down as

well and there you go absolutely beautiful bowl of 
cow oh and this kind of spoon is exactly what you

want Oh such comfort food the broth is flavored 
so perfectly you don't want this to be strong

I mean it's breakfast right you want to start 
your day nice and gentle I'm crunching on the

fried garlic which is super delicious and then the 
shrimp because we didn't overcook it it's nice and

tender and just up so good I'll give you sick 
this is the perfect cold food and oh if you're

going to serve this to a guest make sure you put 
some of the fried the whole shrimp that we so

carefully need on top so people see what it is but 
since I'm just doing this just to show you we're

gonna pretend I didn't forget that part so hope 
you give this a try as you can see it's so easy

the key isn't the bra so make sure you check that 
video out before you make it and when you make it
